If you want a comfortable future in Corryong this is it. Inspections recommended.

Description:
Incredible Lifestyle Farm with Nariel Creek Frontage
This is the ultimate camping, hunting, fishing retreat on approximately 150 acres in the most beautiful part of the Upper Murray, the Nariel Valley.
The Farm includes 80 acres of fertile creek flats sown to perennial pastures with never failing water supply through many spring fed dams and soaks, high rainfall area and small frontage to the Nariel Creek.
A quality set of steel cattle yards with ramp and crush, excellent boundary fencing to main road on both sides and two sheds add to this fantastic farm. One, an old piggery approximately 25 meters x 15 meters, the other shed located next to the yards with power available approximately 15 meters x 15 meters.
The remainder of the farm includes rising hill country with an abundance of wildlife including dear, emus and birdlife. An extremely serine and peaceful part of Australia to relax on weekends in your very own rustic camping area. Fully equipped with solar hot water shower and caravan. This old hay shed with fire place is open to the most incredible view towards the mountains, which often have a dusting of snow.
Only 1 hour and 20 minutes from Wodonga and 25 minutes from Corryong, the farm would qualify for a planning permit (STCA) and there are many quality home sites, power is available at the front gate.
Inspections are strictly by appointment.
Pictures are of the area, more photos of property to come very soon.

Description:
"Bed & Breakfast"
The historic mining town of Corryong has new mining developments about to commence so now your chance to take advantage of population and job creation growth expected to hit Corryong. Are you looking for a lifestyle change with the opportunity to run & build your own B & B with an attached restaurant/function area. Featuring 5 guest bedrooms, & 4 bathroom/spa suites with adjoining lounge & kitchenettes. This property comes complete with all furniture bedding & linen so walk in and start building your nest egg. Along side the guest home is another home circa 1890 with full commercial grade kitchen & walk in cool room & office space. The restaurant/cafe comfortably seats 40 as well as 2 private function rooms, one with OFP. Bar facilities with commercial coffee and all catering equipment. These 2 properties can be run together to compliment and off set one another or the owner will sub-divide if your interest is only in one or the other Inspection is a must by appointment only.

Description:
Heaven on Earth
This once in a lifetime opportunity is available to those wanting their very own beautifully renovated church! If you have ever wanted a home that is something out of the ordinary, then look no further. Sitting on an easy to maintain half acre block of land in the middle of farmland the home is private and secluded.
Originally built in 1899 as a Presbyterian Church with the last service held in 1974, shortly afterwards it was sold and has since evolved into one of the most unique and beautiful homes.
Timber features throughout this character filled home, with a beautiful timber kitchen which has plenty of cupboard space and room for a large fridge, dishwasher, access through to the second living/dining/bedroom. The main living room features an amazing Nectre Mega wood fire providing ample heating and 2 air conditioners to cool the home in the warmer months, a mezzanine level holds the master bedroom, bathroom and toilet that looks out onto farmland and has a view that needs to be seen to be believed.
Beautiful views and a rural outlook everywhere you look whether you are standing inside or outside enjoying the peaceful surrounds of this charming home. Outside there is a large outdoor entertaining area with stencil concrete flooring and outdoor blinds to keep the weather at bay, there is an ample water supply available with 2 x 22,500L concrete water tanks, plus a bore which provides excellent additional water supply, large vegetable garden, herb garden, citrus trees, orchard, 2 KW solar system with 5 KW inverter. There is also a woodshed, with attached chook shed and dog pen.
Shedding on the half acre block includes a 4-bay garage with attached workshop as well as a second shed which features built in studio/office suitable for a beautician, massage therapist, hairdresser with reverse cycle air conditioner.
Taking in the views of the surrounding hills, which include Mount Mittamatite and Mount Kosciuszko, and only a short scenic drive some great freshwater fishing and water sport available in the Murray River, Cudgewa Creek and the Khancoban dam, not far to snowfields.
This could be your escape from the everyday living or your dream property but it's all here for you to move in, enjoy and put your own stamp on this opportunity.

Description:
Stunning Family Lifestyle Property in Snowy High Country
Phone Enquiry ID: 68376
Located just 600 metres off the Murray river, this gorgeous property on a spacious 3.14 acres will not disappoint. Sporting picturesque mountain views, giving that middle of nowhere feel, now is the time to harness this fantastic opportunity to live a relaxed, peaceful country life. Rich with a rural feel, the beautiful property is located just 10kms from Corryong, famous for its annual 'Man from the snowy river' festival. Corryong is equipped with excellent amenities allowing you to access modern necessities without sacrificing quality of life. Plus, a school bus, mail and newspapers all arrive at the front gate! Spend your weekend down at the river enjoying some Cod and Trout fishing, or take a scenic walk along the river bank, or take a scenic drive to the Thredbo Snowfields.
The large amount of land provides for fantastic subdivision potential, or bask in having an easy to manage lifestyle property with endless possibilities. With room for all, the fantastic residence is surrounded by beautiful gardens, including six big leafy 130 year old Elm trees, Oak trees, and an orchard. Equipped for a large range of lifestyle activities, it offers huge potential to steer in any direction you wish. The property includes great fencing, sheep yards, a paddock for horses, sheep, cattle, a brand new Colorbond 12m x 9m powered and heated insulated Shed, plus an older 15m x 10m powered shed with 2 stables and attached chicken shed and yard. There is pet and child proof fencing around the yard and shedding areas.
The home itself is well built with a very attractive and eco-friendly design. You will be impressed by the high ceilings, wooden floors, modern kitchen, expansive open plan living and superb alfresco entertainment. The high end finishes and fixtures create a discerning feel throughout. The large, well appointed kitchen sports a beautiful Rayburn combustion stove and cooktop, ample storage and a gorgeous long island bench which doubles a breakfast bar overlooking the generous lounge and dining. The home is NBN and Foxtel enabled.
Four bedrooms, three of which include built in robes - the luxurious master suite comes equipped with an ensuite and walk-in robe. A central bathroom services the rest of the family with ease. Each room includes sun blinds and double glazed doors and windows. The home is fully Insulated with evaporative heating and cooling throughout, as well as a complete Vacuum system making cleaning a breeze. A fantastic outdoor undercover entertaining area looking out to the stunning mountain views teleports you into absolute serenity.
The home was totally renovated throughout 6 years ago, with very large extensions to both ends of the house. Great for power saving, there is solar hot water panels, solar electricity panels 2.5kw and 25,000L rainwater tank. Plus a 2ML water licence, river pump with separate independent water line, secure dog yards and wood shed.
With plenty to enjoy inside and out, this truly peaceful location and fantastic property is a great place to raise a family, or to enjoy as a hobby farm. Now is your chance to take the leap to acreage living and indulge in a laid back, picturesque country lifestyle.
Internal area
180m²

Description:
Hidden valley on the river in Nariel, North East Victoria High Country
Phone enquiry code for this property : 5625
Phone enquiry code for this property : 8488
Originally a high country cattle station, "Karoola Station" has river frontage to the Crystal clear waters of the Nariel creek which border the property and a Spring feed dam giving you total water security.
The river provides high quality drinking water which is distributed throughout the property by an automatic electric pressure pump along with a large 3 meg spring fed dam in the top paddock.
The property in set in a secluded valley and surrounded by native mountain vistas.
Lovingly maintained and renovated home with easy care mature trees and soft lawns in such a location is a wining formula.
3 Bedrooms all with build in robes
Laundry with storage and second toilet
Very large living area
Kitchen with European gas cooktop and electric oven and dishwasher surrounding large entertainers island bench
New double shower, separate deep bath and double basin with separate toilet
Wool blend carpets, tiles and solid wooden floors
Reverse cycle air conditioners
Option of gas or wood heating
Shedding, -14 x 6m concreted workshop with newly installed mechanics vehicle hoist and plenty of space for storage with power along with evaporative cooling.
4 additional sheds 6 x 15m with power, 5 x 15m with power, 6 x 4m with power and 12 x 4m no power. Provides an enormous amount of space for vehicles, projects and storage.
Also included is a 1.8 x 1.8 meter cool room with new compressor.
Solar 4.8kw
Annual rainfall approx. 1100mm along with 2 meg License

Description:
"Walnut Valley"
IDYLLIC LIFESTYLE RETREAT
37 Ha 92 Acres
FOR PRIVATE SALE INSPECTIONS STRICTLY BY APPOINTMENT ONLY FULL INFORMATION MEMORANDUM AVAILABLE
Own your own piece of Victorian High Country. Exciting opportunity to purchase an idyllic lifestyle property in the beautiful Nariel Valley in close proximity to Corryong township and 120 kilometres from major regional centres of Albury and Wodonga. Private and secluded location with opportunity to run a small number of livestock to generate additional income.
Situated in the beautiful and highly regarded Upper Murray district
Idyllic lifestyle property in private and secluded location
Majority cleared and comprised of undulating to rising topography
Improved pastures with good native grass cover through timbered areas
Perfectly suited to breeding and grazing of small number of livestock
Unfailing water from multiple permanent springs plus rainwater storage
Excellent stock water via two spring fed dams plus semi-permanent creek
Reliable average annual rainfall of 925mm (or 37 inches)
Well maintained three bedroom residence with magnificent district views
Modern kitchen and bathroom with large open plan living/dining area
Includes six berth Mercedes Benz motorhome adjacent to residence
Additional improvements include two lockable sheds and cattle yards
Only 18 kilometres to the south of Corryong township
Approx. 120 kilometres from major regional centres of Albury and Wodonga
For further information or to arrange an inspection please contact John Honeychurch on 0419 790 924 or Mike Weller on 0410 663 041.

Address: 62 Nariel Gap Road Thowgla Valley VIC 3707
Description:
INSPIRING LIFESTYLE OPTION
Situated on a slightly elevated and gently sloping site of approx. 1.2 hectares, this truly self-sufficient, off grid residence and cottage offers a unique lifestyle opportunity.
Located approximately 18km from Corryong, the property overlooks Thowgla Creek and offers stunning valley views, in what could arguably be one of North East Victoria's most scenic regions.
On offer:
- The main residence is of Colorbond construction and offers two bedrooms and study.
- Featuring two bathrooms, one of which services the main bedroom and the other incorporating the laundry.
- The main living space can only be described as large and features beautiful timber floors.
- The striking kitchen offers gas cooking, dishwasher, stone bench tops, glass splashback and soft close cabinetry.
- Stunning enclosed timber deck with kitchenette / BBQ facilities.
- Ducted evaporative cooling and hydronic heating ensure year-round comfort, although the preferred northerly aspect and substantial insulation help regulate temperatures.
- The main shedding is provided in the 7.5m x 9m, Colorbond shed with a suitable garage opening to provide clear access for caravans, boats etc. The shed also offers a shower, toilet and kitchenette.
- A four car carport offers further vehicle accommodation plus additional smaller shedding/workshops are onsite adjacent to these noted buildings.
- The fully self-contained cabin features one bedroom, kitchen facilities, practical bathroom and open living area opening to a small deck.
- Providing a very manageable and self-operated home business, the option to continue Murphy's Cabin' as holiday accommodation is available to purchasers with Air BnB and repeat clientele making up the majority of bookings.
- Council approved option of a second cabin to the property.
- The property has been established to enable 100% off grid, self-sufficient electricity supply featuring a 5Kw solar power system and diesel generator back-up.
- Water is supplied via tank with over 100,000L available via three tanks.
- With a 5.5 star energy rating, this all equates to no bills (other than rates)!!
- Further option to incorporate the purchase of the home operated Upper Murray Blinds & Awnings'.
With such care, thought and precision put into the design and execution of this unrivalled property, it is hard to put into words the lifestyle that is on offer.

Address: Lot 5/2412 Murray Valley Hwy Cudgewa VIC 3705
Description:
RED GUM RISE
BUILD YOUR DREAMS
Red Gum Rise is a rural selection of lifestyle properties that will energise your imagination to enable a lifestyle that encapsulates environmental, community and personal living in the North East Victoria. From the selections overlooking the valleys to the Australian Alps, the choice is now in your hands.
Red Gum rise is located in an ideal location with ample north and east facing vistas, from first light in the morning breaking over the alps to the setting sun to your west, Red Gum Rise has the site to offer solar passive living.
The local mountains protect you from harsh winds and the high snow peaks offering alpine like conditions cooling through-out the winter months.
Situated on the Murray Valley Highway, Red Gum Rise is on the edge of the Cudgewa Village, 12 kilometers west of Corryong, 120 Kilometres from Albury/Wodonga and midway between Sydney and Melbourne.
Corryong is close to the Burrowa-Pine Mountain National Park and the massive Alpine National Park.
